bolometer/camera.documentation: Set of cameras. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic.

bolometer/camera/name.documentation: Short string identifier (unique for a given device). Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras.

bolometer/camera/description.documentation: Description, e.g. “Camera viewing the upper divertor”. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras.

bolometer/camera/channel.documentation: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera). Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras.

bolometer/camera/channel/name.documentation: Short string identifier (unique for a given device). Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera).

bolometer/camera/channel/description.documentation: Description, e.g. “channel viewing the upper divertor”. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera).

bolometer/camera/channel/detector.documentation: Detector description. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera).

bolometer/camera/channel/detector/geomet.documentation: Type of geometry used to describe the surface of the detector or aperture (1:'outline', 2:'circular', 3:'rectangle'). In case of 'outline', the surface is described by an outline of point in a local coordinate system defined by a centre and three unit vectors X1, X2, X3. Note that there is some flexibility here and the data provider should choose the most convenient coordinate system for the object, respecting the definitions of (X1,X2,X3) indicated below. In case of 'circular', the surface is a circle defined by its centre, radius, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.  In case of 'rectangle', the surface is a rectangle defined by its centre, widths in the X1 and X2 directions, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera). Within detector container: Detector description.

bolometer/camera/channel/detector/centre.documentation: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera). Within detector container: Detector description.

Major radius. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera). Within detector container: Detector description. Within centre container: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area.

Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above). Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera). Within detector container: Detector description. Within centre container: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area.

Height. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera). Within detector container: Detector description. Within centre container: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area.

bolometer/camera/channel/detector/radius.documentation: Radius of the circle, used only if geometry_type = 2. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera). Within detector container: Detector description.

bolometer/camera/channel/detector/x1_uni.documentation: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is more horizontal than X2 (has a smaller abs(Z) component) and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above). Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera). Within detector container: Detector description.

Component along X axis. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera). Within detector container: Detector description. Within x1_unit_vector container: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is more horizontal than X2 (has a smaller abs(Z) component) and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above).

Component along Y axis. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera). Within detector container: Detector description. Within x1_unit_vector container: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is more horizontal than X2 (has a smaller abs(Z) component) and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above).

The X1 vector is more horizontal than X2 (has a smaller abs(Z) component) and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above).

bolometer/camera/channel/detector/x2_uni.documentation: Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera). Within detector container: Detector description.

Component along X axis. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera). Within detector container: Detector description. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1.

Within detector container: Detector description. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1.

The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1.

bolometer/camera/channel/detector/x3_uni.documentation: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the detector/aperture plane and oriented towards the plasma. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera). Within detector container: Detector description.

Component along X axis. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera). Within detector container: Detector description. Within x3_unit_vector container: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the detector/aperture plane and oriented towards the plasma.

Component along Y axis. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera). Within detector container: Detector description. Within x3_unit_vector container: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the detector/aperture plane and oriented towards the plasma.

The X3 axis is normal to the detector/aperture plane and oriented towards the plasma.

bolometer/camera/channel/detector/x1_wid.documentation: Full width of the aperture in the X1 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera). Within detector container: Detector description.

bolometer/camera/channel/detector/x2_wid.documentation: Full width of the aperture in the X2 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera). Within detector container: Detector description.

bolometer/camera/channel/detector/outlin.documentation: Irregular outline of the detector/aperture in the (X1, X2) coordinate system. Repeat the first point since this is a closed contour. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera). Within detector container: Detector description.

Positions along x1 axis. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera). Within detector container: Detector description. Within outline container: Irregular outline of the detector/aperture in the (X1, X2) coordinate system. Repeat the first point since this is a closed contour.

Positions along x2 axis. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera). Within detector container: Detector description. Within outline container: Irregular outline of the detector/aperture in the (X1, X2) coordinate system. Repeat the first point since this is a closed contour.

bolometer/camera/channel/detector/surfac.documentation: Surface of the detector/aperture, derived from the above geometric data. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. bolometer/camera/channel/subcollimators_.documentation: Number of sub-collimators. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera).

Thickness of separation between sub-collimators. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera).

bolometer/camera/channel/etendue.documentation: Etendue (geometric extent) of the channel's optical system. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera).

bolometer/camera/channel/etendue_method.documentation: Method used to calculate the etendue. Index = 0 : exact calculation with a 4D integral; 1 : approximation with first order formula (detector surface times solid angle subtended by the apertures); 2 : other methods. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera).

bolometer/camera/channel/etendue_method/.documentation: Short string identifier. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera). Within etendue_method container: Method used to calculate the etendue. Index = 0 : exact calculation with a 4D integral; 1 : approximation with first order formula (detector surface times solid angle subtended by the apertures); 2 : other methods.

Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera). Within etendue_method container: Method used to calculate the etendue. Index = 0 : exact calculation with a 4D integral; 1 : approximation with first order formula (detector surface times solid angle subtended by the apertures); 2 : other methods.

Verbose description. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera). Within etendue_method container: Method used to calculate the etendue. Index = 0 : exact calculation with a 4D integral; 1 : approximation with first order formula (detector surface times solid angle subtended by the apertures); 2 : other methods.

bolometer/camera/channel/line_of_sight.documentation: Description of the reference line of sight of the channel, defined by two points when the beam is not reflected, a third point is added to define the reflected beam path. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera).

Within second_point container: Position of the second point.

Within line_of_sight container: Description of the reference line of sight of the channel, defined by two points when the beam is not reflected, a third point is added to define the reflected beam path. Within second_point container: Position of the second point.

bolometer/camera/channel/line_of_sight/t.documentation: Position of the third point. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera). Within line_of_sight container: Description of the reference line of sight of the channel, defined by two points when the beam is not reflected, a third point is added to define the reflected beam path.

Major radius. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera). Within line_of_sight container: Description of the reference line of sight of the channel, defined by two points when the beam is not reflected, a third point is added to define the reflected beam path. Within third_point container: Position of the third point.

Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above). Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera). Within line_of_sight container: Description of the reference line of sight of the channel, defined by two points when the beam is not reflected, a third point is added to define the reflected beam path. Within third_point container: Position of the third point.

Height. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera). Within line_of_sight container: Description of the reference line of sight of the channel, defined by two points when the beam is not reflected, a third point is added to define the reflected beam path. Within third_point container: Position of the third point.

bolometer/camera/channel/power.documentation: Power received on the detector. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera).

bolometer/camera/channel/power/data.documentation: Data. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera). Within power container: Power received on the detector.

bolometer/camera/channel/power/time.documentation: Time. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera). Within power container: Power received on the detector.

bolometer/camera/channel/validity_timed.documentation: Indicator of the validity of the channel as a function of time (0 means valid, negative values mean non-valid). Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera).

bolometer/camera/channel/validity_timed/.documentation: Data. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera). Within validity_timed container: Indicator of the validity of the channel as a function of time (0 means valid, negative values mean non-valid).

Time. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera). Within validity_timed container: Indicator of the validity of the channel as a function of time (0 means valid, negative values mean non-valid).

bolometer/camera/channel/validity.documentation: Indicator of the validity of the channel for the whole acquisition period (0 means valid, negative values mean non-valid). Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within camera container: Set of cameras. Within channel container: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera).

bolometer/power_radiated_total.documentation: Total radiated power reconstructed from bolometry data. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic.

bolometer/power_radiated_inside_lcfs.documentation: Radiated power from the plasma inside the Last Closed Flux Surface, reconstructed from bolometry data. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic.

bolometer/power_radiated_validity.documentation: Validity flag related to the radiated power reconstructions. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic.

bolometer/grid_type.documentation: Selection of one of a set of grid types for the 2D power density map. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic.

options.name: rectangular
options.description: Cylindrical R,Z ala eqdsk (R=dim1, Z=dim2). In this case the position arrays should not be filled since they are redundant with grid/dim1 and dim2.

options.name: inverse
options.description: Rhopolar_polar 2D polar coordinates (rho=dim1, theta=dim2) with magnetic axis as centre of grid; the polar angle is theta= -atan2(z-zaxis,r-raxis).

options.name: inverse_psi_straight_field_line
options.description: Flux surface type with psi as radial label (dim1) and the straight-field line poloidal angle (mod(index,10)=1) (dim2); could be non-equidistant; magnetic axis as centre of grid

options.name: inverse_psi_equal_arc
options.description: Flux surface type with psi as radial label (dim1) and the equal arc poloidal angle (mod(index,10)=2) (dim2)

options.name: inverse_psi_polar
options.description: Flux surface type with psi as radial label (dim1) and the polar poloidal angle (mod(index,10)=3) (dim2); could be non-equidistant

options.name: inverse_psi_straight_field_line_fourier
options.description: Flux surface type with psi as radial label (dim1) and Fourier modes in the straight-field line poloidal angle (mod(index,10)=4) (dim2), could be non-equidistant; magnetic axis as centre of grid

options.name: inverse_psi_equal_arc_fourier
options.description: Flux surface type with psi as radial label (dim1) and Fourier modes in the equal arc poloidal angle (mod(index,10)=5) (dim2)

options.name: inverse_psi_polar_fourier
options.description: Flux surface type with psi as radial label (dim1) and Fourier modes in the polar poloidal angle (mod(index,10)=6) (dim2); could be non-equidistant

options.name: inverse_rhopolnorm_straight_field_line
options.description: Flux surface type with radial label sqrt[(psi-psi_axis)/(psi_edge-psi_axis)] (dim1) and the straight-field line poloidal angle (dim2)

options.name: inverse_rhopolnorm_equal_arc
options.description: Flux surface type with radial label sqrt[(psi-psi_axis)/(psi_edge-psi_axis)] (dim1) and the equal arc poloidal angle (dim2)

options.name: inverse_rhopolnorm_polar
options.description: Flux surface type with radial label sqrt[(psi-psi_axis)/(psi_edge-psi_axis)] (dim1) and the polar poloidal angle (dim2)

options.name: inverse_rhopolnorm_straight_field_line_fourier
options.description: Flux surface type with radial label sqrt[(psi-psi_axis)/(psi_edge-psi_axis)] (dim1) and Fourier modes in the straight-field line poloidal angle (dim2)

options.name: inverse_rhopolnorm_equal_arc_fourier
options.description: Flux surface type with radial label sqrt[(psi-psi_axis)/(psi_edge-psi_axis)] (dim1) and Fourier modes in the equal arc poloidal angle (dim2)

options.name: inverse_rhopolnorm_polar_fourier
options.description: Flux surface type with radial label sqrt[(psi-psi_axis)/(psi_edge-psi_axis)] (dim1) and Fourier modes in the polar poloidal angle (dim2)

options.name: inverse_rhotornorm_straight_field_line
options.description: Flux surface type with radial label sqrt[Phi/Phi_edge] (dim1) and the straight-field line poloidal angle (dim2)

options.name: inverse_rhotornorm_equal_arc
options.description: Flux surface type with radial label sqrt[Phi/Phi_edge] (dim1) and the equal arc poloidal angle (dim2)

options.name: inverse_rhotornorm_polar
options.description: Flux surface type with radial label sqrt[Phi/Phi_edge] (dim1) and the polar poloidal angle (dim2)

options.name: inverse_rhotornorm_straight_field_line_fourier
options.description: Flux surface type with radial label sqrt[Phi/Phi_edge] (dim1) and Fourier modes in the straight-field line poloidal angle (dim2)

options.name: inverse_rhotornorm_equal_arc_fourier
options.description: Flux surface type with radial label sqrt[Phi/Phi_edge] (dim1) and Fourier modes in the equal arc poloidal angle (dim2)

options.name: inverse_rhotornorm_polar_fourier
options.description: Flux surface type with radial label sqrt[Phi/Phi_edge] (dim1) and Fourier modes in the polar poloidal angle (dim2)

options.name: inverse_rhopol_straight_field_line
options.description: Flux surface type with radial label sqrt[psi-psi_axis] (dim1) and the straight-field line poloidal angle (dim2)

options.name: inverse_rhopol_equal_arc
options.description: Flux surface type with radial label sqrt[psi-psi_axis] (dim1) and the equal arc poloidal angle (dim2)

options.name: inverse_rhopol_polar
options.description: Flux surface type with radial label sqrt[psi-psi_axis] (dim1) and the polar poloidal angle (dim2)

options.name: inverse_rhopol_straight_field_line_fourier
options.description: Flux surface type with radial label sqrt[psi-psi_axis] (dim1) and Fourier modes in the straight-field line poloidal angle (dim2)

options.name: inverse_rhopol_equal_arc_fourier
options.description: Flux surface type with radial label sqrt[psi-psi_axis] (dim1) and Fourier modes in the equal arc poloidal angle (dim2)

options.name: inverse_rhopol_polar_fourier
options.description: Flux surface type with radial label sqrt[psi-psi_axis] (dim1) and Fourier modes in the polar poloidal angle (dim2)

options.name: inverse_rhotor_straight_field_line
options.description: Flux surface type with radial label sqrt[Phi/pi/B0] (dim1), Phi being toroidal flux, and the straight-field line poloidal angle (dim2)

options.name: inverse_rhotor_equal_arc
options.description: Flux surface type with radial label sqrt[Phi/pi/B0] (dim1), Phi being toroidal flux, and the equal arc poloidal angle (dim2)

options.name: inverse_rhotor_polar
options.description: Flux surface type with radial label sqrt[Phi/pi/B0] (dim1), Phi being toroidal flux, and the polar poloidal angle (dim2)

options.name: inverse_rhotor_straight_field_line_fourier
options.description: Flux surface type with radial label sqrt[Phi/pi/B0] (dim1), Phi being toroidal flux, and Fourier modes in the straight-field line poloidal angle (dim2)

options.name: inverse_rhotor_equal_arc_fourier
options.description: Flux surface type with radial label sqrt[Phi/pi/B0] (dim1), Phi being toroidal flux, and Fourier modes in the equal arc poloidal angle (dim2)

options.name: inverse_rhotor_polar_fourier
options.description: Flux surface type with radial label sqrt[Phi/pi/B0] (dim1), Phi being toroidal flux, and Fourier modes in the polar poloidal angle (dim2)

options.name: irregular_rz_na
options.description: Irregular grid, thus give list of vertices in dim1(1:ndim1), dim2(1:ndim1) and then all fields are on values(1:ndim1,1)

bolometer/grid_type/name.documentation: Short string identifier. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within grid_type container: Selection of one of a set of grid types for the 2D power density map.

bolometer/grid_type/index.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within grid_type container: Selection of one of a set of grid types for the 2D power density map.

bolometer/grid_type/description.documentation: Verbose description. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within grid_type container: Selection of one of a set of grid types for the 2D power density map.

bolometer/grid.documentation: Definition of the 2D grid (the content of dim1 and dim2 is defined by the selected grid_type). Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic.

bolometer/grid/dim1.documentation: First dimension values. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within grid container: Definition of the 2D grid (the content of dim1 and dim2 is defined by the selected grid_type).

bolometer/grid/dim2.documentation: Second dimension values. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within grid container: Definition of the 2D grid (the content of dim1 and dim2 is defined by the selected grid_type).

bolometer/grid/volume_element.documentation: Volume of plasma enclosed in the cell formed by the nodes [dim1(i) dim2(j)], [dim1(i+1) dim2(j)], [dim1(i) dim2(j+1)] and [dim1(i+1) dim2(j+1)]. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within grid container: Definition of the 2D grid (the content of dim1 and dim2 is defined by the selected grid_type).

bolometer/power_density.documentation: Power density map in the poloidal cross-section, obtained from tomographic inversion of the bolometer data. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic.

bolometer/power_density/data.documentation: Data. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within power_density container: Power density map in the poloidal cross-section, obtained from tomographic inversion of the bolometer data.

bolometer/power_density/time.documentation: Time. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic. Within power_density container: Power density map in the poloidal cross-section, obtained from tomographic inversion of the bolometer data.

bolometer/latency.documentation: Upper bound of the delay between physical information received by the detector and data available on the real-time (RT) network. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic.

bolometer/time.documentation: Generic time. Within bolometer IDS: Bolometer diagnostic.
